sn6.13:4.1: At one time the Buddha was staying in the land of the Magadhans at Andhakavinda.
sn6.13:4.2: Now at that time the Buddha was meditating in the open during the dark of night, while a gentle rain drizzled down.
sn6.13:4.3: Then, late at night, the beautiful Brahmā Sahampati, lighting up the entirety of Andhakavinda, went up to the Buddha,
sn6.13:4.5: and recited these verses in the Buddha’s presence:
sn6.13:5.2: and practice to be released from fetters.
sn6.13:5.3: If you don’t find enjoyment there,
sn6.13:5.4: live in the Saṅgha, guarded and mindful.
sn6.13:6.1: Walking for alms from family to family,
sn6.13:6.2: with senses guarded, self-disciplined and mindful.
sn6.13:6.4: free of fear, freed in the fearless.
sn6.13:7.2: where the lighting flashes and the sky thunders
sn6.13:7.3: in the dark of the night;
sn6.13:7.4: there meditates a mendicant, free of goosebumps.
sn6.13:8.1: For this has in fact been seen by me,
sn6.13:8.2: it isn’t just what the testament says.
sn6.13:8.4: a thousand are destroyers of Death.
sn6.13:9.1: And of trainees there’s more than five hundred,
sn6.13:9.4: freed from rebirth in the animal realm.
sn6.13:10.2: who I think have shared in merit—
